featured.text: In forested areas with thick tree crowns, there is intense struggle for these resources.
Left ______ for years, the deserted house was filled with a thick coating of dust and a smell of old damp wood.
An iron rod is used to strike the thicker glass hemispheres.
When mothers try to dig their babies out, both may be trapped and smothered by thick mud.

other.text: 24 fresh onions, they have multiple layers of thick, dark, papery skin.
The cactus’s thick outer layer (i.e., husk), with all those spines, had always been viewed as a waste product until researchers developed a biogas generator to turn the husks into electricity.
This bark can be pretty thick, well over two feet in the more mature trees.
One evening a guest in the dining hall felt that his potatoes were too thick and sent them back to the kitchen.

definition.zh_def: 形容物體的寬度或深度大，通常指比一般情況下的尺寸更大。
definition.en_def: Having a large distance between opposite sides; not thin.
definition.example: The book was so thick that it took me a week to read it.
